sentence.Network_en: It was a lie, tout court.

ensemble是什么意思... ... Best Ensemble ： 在线影评人协会奖 Tout Ensemble ： 概观 Tout Ensemble ： 法〕全体一起.
...tout〔法〕全部的，整个的；任何，所有，一切。tout ensemble〔法〕全体一起。T.P.tempo primo之缩写。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English tute 'look out', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tuit 'spout, nozzle'. Later senses were 'watch, spy on' (late 17th cent.) and 'solicit custom' (mid 18th cent.). The noun was first recorded (early 18th cent.) in the slang use 'thieves' lookout'
French, suggested by le tout Paris 'all (of) Paris', used to refer to Parisian high society

entry.def: If someone touts something, they try to sell it or convince people that it is good.

example.ex: It has the trappings of an election campaign in the United States, with slick television ads touting the candidates.
example.tran: 它具有美国竞选活动的典型特征，即通过华而不实的电视广告来吹嘘候选人。

example.ex: …a popular advertising industry practice of using performers to tout products…
example.tran: 广告业常用的利用艺人来兜售产品的做法

entry.def: If someone touts for business or custom, they try to obtain it.

example.ex: He visited Thailand and Singapore to tout for investment...
example.tran: 他访问了泰国与新加坡，以期招揽投资。

example.ex: Minicabs are not allowed to tout for hire on the streets.
example.tran: 小型出租车禁止在街上兜揽生意。

entry.tran: (在体育场或剧院外)倒卖(高价票)
entry.def: If someone touts tickets, they sell them outside a sports ground or theatre, usually for more than their original value.

example.ex: ...a man who made his money touting tickets...
The queue stretches several hundred yards and tickets are touted for a tenner.
example.tran: 队伍排得有几百码长，票被炒到 10 英镑一张。

entry.def: A tout is someone who sells things such as tickets unofficially, usually at prices which are higher than the official ones.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who buys tickets to an event in order to resell them at a profit
2. someone who advertises for customers in an especially brazen way
3. one who sells advice about gambling or speculation (especially at the racetrack)

sentences.sentence: "This product was touted as a revolutionary invention"

sentences.en: He’s been touting his novel around publishers for years.
sentences.cn: 他几年来一直到处找出版商兜售自己的小说。
